in.prompt:
def words_string(s):
    """
    You will be given a string of words separated by commas or spaces. Your task is
    to split the string into words and return an array of the words.
    
    For example:
    words_string("Hi, my name is John") == ["Hi", "my", "name", "is", "John"]
    words_string("One, two, three, four, five, six") == ["One", "two", "three", "four", "five", "six"]
    """

out.code:
import random
import string


def test_words_string_function():
    # Test with random cases
    for _ in range(1000):
        num_words = random.randint(1, 10)
        random_words = ["".join(random.choices(string.ascii_letters, k=random.randint(1, 10))) for _ in range(num_words)]
        # Randomly choose between commas and spaces
        if random.choice([True, False]):
            s = ", ".join(random_words)
        else:
            s = " ".join(random_words)
        assert words_string(s) == random_words

    # Edge cases
    # Test with no separator (single word)
    assert words_string("Hello") == ["Hello"]
    # Test with multiple spaces
    assert words_string("This  is    a test") == ["This", "is", "a", "test"]
    # Test with leading and trailing spaces
    assert words_string("  Leading and trailing  ") == ["Leading", "and", "trailing"]
    # Test with commas only
    assert words_string("Comma,only,test,") == ["Comma", "only", "test"]
    # Test with a mixture of separators
    assert words_string("Mix,of words, using both separators") == ["Mix", "of", "words", "using", "both", "separators"]
    # Test with all spaces
    assert words_string("   ") == []
    
    # Test with all commas
    assert words_string(",,,,,") == []
